Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204 - 6992.

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility placed 4 youth in a van to transport them to another
facility. During the transport, the youth went AWOL where they
2

wandered the city until located by law enforcement. Additionally,
the youth have accessed the medical cabinet and stole
medication. There are allegations a group of youth assaulted one
youth, resulting in that youth's hospitalization.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed via telephone on September 6, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2 who was face to face
with Youth A at Wayne County Juvenile Detention Center
(JDC). Youth A reported he was outside having recreation, when
the police told him he was being moved. Youth A stated the
police placed him in handcuffs and Staff 1 and Staff 2 transported
him to JDC. Youth A stated Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were
transported in one van and Youth E, a girl, was transported in a
different van. Youth A denied anything happening in the van by
the youth. DHHS Worker 2 asked Youth A what took place when
the youths got to JDC. Youth A described kicking the back door of
the van multiple times and all the youth pushed the door open.
Youth A reported this took place right by JDC. Youth A stated
Staff 1 called Director when Staff 1 saw all the youth were trying to
get out of the van. Youth A reported the van sped up so we could
not get out. Youth A described a police officer turning around the
corner, so Staff 1 and Staff 2 tried to get to the police to get help.
Youth A stated all four of the youth were able to get the van door
open and jumped out just around the corner from JDC. Youth A
reported Youth B and Youth D got back into the van, but Youth A
and Youth C started running. Youth A stated the police turned
around and started driving behind Youth A and Youth C. Youth A
stated he turned back toward the police with his hands up, Youth
C did the same, and the police placed Youth A and Youth C in
handcuffs and took them to JDC. Youth A stated this was about
one block from JDC. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 did all
they could do to stop them from getting out of the van but there
really was nothing that could stop them. Youth A described the
transport van as having a window between the back seat and front
seat, child locks on all the doors and the windows as
“unbreakable.” Youth A stated staff sit in the front, not in the back
with the youth.
Youth A described stealing a company van the day before being
moved to JDC. Youth A reported he broke into the supervisor’s
office and stole the van keys. Youth A stated he knew the van
keys were kept in the office because he had seen staff go into the
office to get the keys. Youth A reported the van keys were in a
locked box in the locked supervisor office. Youth A described
breaking into the office, grabbing the box, throwing it on the
ground and breaking the box to get the keys. Youth A denied any
staff being present when breaking into the office or the box. Youth
3

A stated there were four or five other youth present but could not
recall their names. Youth A reported this took place around 3 or
4am. Youth A stated staff were in the building but were in the two
units with other youth. Youth A described Supervisor 1 being
outside but was unsure why he was outside. Youth A stated after
getting the van keys he ran outside, found the van, drove it around
the parking lot and then parked the van and ran back to the unit
because the police were coming. Youth A reported another youth
drove a different van and crashed that van. Youth A denied
knowing what youth was driving the van that crashed or who the
other youth were that were out of the units.
Youth A denied being aware of any youth breaking into a medical
building or cabinet and gaining access to medication.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on September 6, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2 who was face to face
with Youth B at JDC. Youth B stated he was onsite doing
community service when two police cars arrived and told Youth B,
he was being moved to JDC. Youth B reported he could not recall
what staff drove the van or the names of the other youth in the van
being transported to JDC. Youth B stated he fell asleep on the
ride to JDC, woke up and the police were there because one of
the youth had run. Youth B denied knowing the name of the youth
that ran. Youth B reported he never heard anything during the
transport to JDC and stated he was sleeping.
Youth B reported he heard someone took a van while at Clarence
Fischer Center and crashed it into a pole. Youth B denied
knowing who took the van or how the youth got the van keys.
Youth B stated he was asleep for the whole thing, he just heard
about the incident when he woke up in the morning.
Youth B denied knowing anything about youth breaking into a
medicine cabinet or medical building and stealing medication.
Youth C was interviewed via telephone on September 6, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2 who was face to face
with Youth C at JDC. Youth C reported he and Youth A, Youth
B, and Youth D were moved to JDC and transported by staff from
Clarence Fischer Center. Youth C stated he could not recall the
staffs’ names. Youth C reported he, Youth A, Youth B, and Youth
D, started pounding and kicking the door of the van until it opened
about a block from JDC. Youth C reported he jumped out of the
van with another youth while the other two youth stayed in the
van. Youth C could not recall who stayed in the van and who
4

jumped out of the van with him. Youth C stated the staff from
Clarence Fischer Center followed in the van. Youth C described
turning the corner, seeing a bunch of police cars so Youth C
stopped and came back to the van and was taken to JDC. Youth
C reported the staff driving the van were yelling for the youth to
stop kicking the door and to not try and get out of the van. Youth
C stated there was nothing the staff could do. Youth C reported
being out of the van only for a few minutes before the police and
staff took him to JDC.
Youth C denied knowing anything about company vans being
stolen by youth at Clarence Fischer Center.
Youth C denied knowing anything about a medicine cabinet or
medical building being broken into and medicine stolen.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on September 6, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2 who was face to face
with Youth D at JDC. Youth D described coming back from the
gym and the police were at Clarence Fischer Center and told him
he was moving to JDC. Youth D reported the police put handcuffs
and leg shackles on him while Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
were placed in handcuffs by the police. Youth D stated he went
willingly into the van, but the others were “trippin for real.” Youth
D stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 transported them to JDC. Youth D
reported he fell asleep in the van and once arriving at JDC found
out the others escaped from the van. Youth D reported he does
not know how Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C got out of the van.
Youth D stated, “I was asleep for real.” Youth D denied hearing
youth pound or kick the door or do anything to get out of the van.
Youth D stated he heard about the vans being stolen but was not
part of the situation. Youth D reported he was not sure what youth
were involved with stealing the keys for the vans.
Youth D denied knowing anything about a medicine cabinet or
medical building being broken into and medicine stolen.
Nurse was interviewed via telephone on September 9, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Nurse described all the
youths’ medicine, except what youth take daily, is stored in the
medical building in a locked medication cart, behind a locked door
in a locked office. Nurse stated the medication cart has a double
lock and is located behind two locked doors. Nurse denied youth
ever breaking into where the medication is kept in the medical
building. Nurse reported some boys’ broke windows at the
5

medical building but where the medication is stored was not
compromised. Nurse stated she believed the windows were
broken on September 2 or early morning hours of September 3,
2024. Nurse stated the daily medication at the facility is in a
locked medication cart, in the locked supervisor office. Nurse
denied being aware of any youth gaining access onsite to the
medication locked in the supervisor’s office.
Director 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 11, 2024, and via telephone on October 4, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Director 1 described Youth
A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D being transported in a secure
van to JDC. Director 1 reported she received a call from Staff 1
saying they arrived at the new building for JDC, learned she was
at the wrong gate and while driving to the correct gate Youth A,
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were kicking the back door of the
van trying to break it open. Director 1 stated while she was on the
phone with Staff 1, the youth were able to kick open the van door
and Youth A and Youth C jumped out of the van. Director 1 stated
she remained on the phone with Staff 1 who said a Wayne State
Police car was driving by so Director 1 instructed Staff 1 to waive
the police down and ask for assistance. Director 1 reported
Wayne State Police apprehended the youth, and the Wayne
County Apprehension team came and transport all four youth to
JDC.
Director 1 reported Director 2 was contacted that morning to have
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D escalated to JDC that
day. Director 1 stated all of the youths’ workers were contacted
as well as Wayne County Care Management Organization (CMO)
to escalate the youth quickly. Director 1 stated she believed
Director 2 was going to court to get the hearings quickly so all the
youths would be escalated. Director 1 stated the facility always
transports youth to their next placement. Director 1 reported the
facility has a secure van they use for transport.
Director 1 described Youth A and Youth D stealing two vans and
Youth D crashing one of the vans into a pole. Director 1 denied
any youth getting injured. Director 1 described the youth gaining
access to the keys by breaking into the supervisor office and
breaking open the locked box where the van keys were kept about
3:30am. Director 1 stated ratio at night is one staff to four youth
and the youth were in different units, so the staff in each unit
stayed in the unit with the other youth who did not leave the unit.
Director 1 denied being out of ratio. Director 1 reported working
18 hours that day and not leaving until 12:30am. Director 1 stated
6

when she left all the youth were back on their own units. Director
1 stated when she returned home, approximately 30 minutes later,
Staff 5 called to inform her the youth were out of their units.
Director 1 reported Supervisor 1 called and reported staff were
looking for the youth. Director 1 stated she fell asleep for a few
hours and when she woke there were several messages from
Supervisor 1. Director 1 reported she spoke with Supervisor 1
after Youth A and Youth D stole the company vans.
Director 1 stated there were no additional staff to add on shift as
there were no extra staff employed. Director 1 reported everyone
was being mandated to work, the company had already
implemented an extra $100 per shift to staff, a temporary
company had been contacted for staffing, maintenance and cook
staff were working shifts and the facility had stopped taking
placements of youth. Director 1 stated she was working to get
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, and Youth E escalated and
moved to JDC and the CMO providers had been contacted
multiple times. Director 1 reported these youth had already been
placed at the facility prior to her becoming the director.
Director 1 denied being aware of any youth breaking into a
medical cabinet or medical building and getting medication.
JDC Director was interviewed via Teams on September 12,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. JDC Director
reported Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D broke out of the
van about one block from JDC, were apprehended by Wayne
State Police right away and transported by Wayne County
Apprehension team to JDC. JDC Director stated she personally
went to court to get the court orders for Youth A, Youth B, Youth
C, and Youth D to be placed at JDC. JDC Director reported she
was not aware of who made the decision to transport the youth to
JDC.
JDC Director stated when planning for Youth A, Youth B, Youth C,
and Youth D to leave Clarence Fischer Center and come to JDC
she learned some youth had broken into a medical building or
office, did not get any medication, and had stolen company vans
and crashed them.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on September 13, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Staff 1 described driving
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D in a secure van with Staff
2 to JDC. Staff 1 stated when she arrived at Clarence Fischer
Center for the transport all four youth were in handcuffs and the
7

police were putting the youth in the van. Staff 1 stated when she
came on shift, she was aware she would be transporting youth to
JDC with Staff 2. Staff 1 reported the whole ride was calm, the
youth were talking with Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 1 stated once
arriving at the entrance to JDC Staff 1 learned the entrance had
moved so they drove to a different entrance. Staff 1 described
this is when Youth A started kicking the window and door of the
van. Staff 1 stated she called Director 1 to explain what was
occurring. Staff 1 reported the kicking caused the door frame to
bend and all four youth jumped out of the van. Staff 1 stated she
saw a police car, started beeping the horn, and the police car
turned around to assist. Staff 1 reported Youth B and Youth D got
back into the van after seeing the police car, but Youth A and
Youth C continued to run with the police following. Staff 1 stated
Youth A and Youth C were out of the vehicle about 10-12 minutes
but were in line of sight other than when the police had the youth.
Staff 1 stated Youth B and Youth D surrendered to the police and
the task force transported all the youth to JDC. Staff 1 reported
she kept telling Youth A to stop kicking the window and door and
tried to convince Youth A his actions would only cause things to
be worse for him.
Staff 1 reported she was told about the vans getting stolen but
was not working when it occurred. Staff 1 stated she heard about
the incident when she came to work to transport Youth A, Youth
B, Youth C, and Youth D to JDC.
Staff 1 stated she was not aware of any times youth got into a
medication cabinet or building and stole medication.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone on September 18,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1 who was face to
face at the facility with Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 stated he
was not working when Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D
were transported to JDC. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A, Youth
B, Youth C, and Youth D were moved to JDC the same day of the
incident described below.
Supervisor 1 described Youth A, Youth D, Youth F, and Youth H
from unit 3, were walking around and sitting in unit 1, when they
were not supposed to be in unit 1. Supervisor 1 stated Staff 4 and
Staff 5 were trying to get Youth A, Youth D, Youth F, and Youth H
back to unit 3 but the youth would not listen and ended up running
out of the facility from the unit door. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 4
and himself followed Youth A, Youth D, Youth F, and Youth H
outside. Supervisor 1 stated the youth had run to Vassar House
8

(girls’ facility on property) in the past, so he headed that way.
Supervisor 1 described getting to the staff parking lot and seeing
the four youth from unit 3 as well as Youth C and Youth G from
unit 1. Supervisor 1 reported when the youth saw Staff 4 and
himself, they all took off running in different directions. Staff 4
described taking off in the general direction of where some of the
youth ran and Staff 4 going in a different direction where youth
ran. Supervisor 1 stated this was the third double he had worked
in a row and youth had been going AWOL pretty frequently.
Supervisor 1 described receiving a phone call at approximately
3:28am from Vassar House staff but could not recall who. They
reported Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C were pounding on the
door trying to talk with the girls. Supervisor 1 stated he went to
Vassar House, talked with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C, trying
to get them to return to their units. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A
said, “Not sure why you are following us, you are not going to
catch us,” then all three youth took off running down the trail.
Supervisor 1 stated he returned to Clarence Fischer Center (CFC)
and saw the supervisor door open and the brown box where the
vehicle keys are locked smashed on the floor with only one of the
four key bags on the floor. Supervisor 1 stated Youth G and
Youth H had returned to CFC and said “yo they [Youth A and
Youth D] stupid.” Supervisor 1 reported he ran outside and could
hear a vehicle going very fast and see lights going back and forth
in the staff parking lot. Supervisor 1 stated when he got to the
staff parking lot one of the company vans was crashed into a light
pole, there were no youth around and the police were there.
Supervisor 1 described returning with the police to CFC to find all
the youth had returned.
Supervisor 1 stated when Youth A, Youth C, Youth D, Youth F,
Youth G, and Youth H ran from the facility, Supervisor 1 and Staff
4 spent a lot of time outside looking for them. Supervisor 1
reported Staff 5 was in unit 1 with Youth B while Staff 6 was in unit
4 with four youth who were sleeping. Supervisor 1 stated he
spoke with Supervisor 2 at Vassar House several times, but
Supervisor 2 was not able to help look for the youth because
Vassar House staff were trying to keep the girls in their units and
not run with Youth A and Youth C who were banging on the unit
doors trying to get the girls to run. Supervisor 1 described it was
the early morning hours so there was only one staff in each unit,
and he was the supervisor on duty, the only extra person.
Supervisor 1 stated leading up to this night there had been several
AWOLs at night by both the girls and boys where they were
meeting in the cabins in the woods (this is being investigated
9

under 2024SIC0001720 and 2024SIC0001725). Supervisor 1
reported the facility would normally have extra staff but there were
no extra staff because staff had quit, walked out, or had already
worked doubles. Supervisor 1 denied ever being out of ratio, just
not having enough extra staff to help with the issues going on at
the facility. Supervisor 1 stated administration was offering
incentive pay and bonuses for working your assigned shift and if
you picked up an extra shift. Supervisor 1 described cooks,
human resource staff and maintenance staff were working shifts,
and the Director was working 18 hours at a time to help.
Supervisor 1 stated staff were quitting because of the mandated
hours, getting injured by youth, and having their personal vehicles
damaged by youth throwing rocks and breaking the windows.
Supervisor 1 stated there were no extra staff present this night
because there were no extra staff to even contact. Supervisor 1
reported everyone knew behaviors and incidents were going on
but did not have extra staff to pull from to help with the issues.
Supervisor 1 described from August 27 until this incident “a lot of
crazy stuff in a short amount of time was happening.” Supervisor
1 reported youth and the units were getting searched, and staff
would try to prevent issues with the youth prior to things occurring
but the youth were frequently going AWOL and not listening to
verbal redirection.
Supervisor 1 denied being aware of any youth breaking into a
medication cabinet or building and getting medication.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via telephone on September 18,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1 who was face to
face at the facility with Supervisor 2. Supervisor 2 reported
being in unit 5 at Vassar House, filling in for a staff who was on
break, when Supervisor 2 heard banging on unit 5 door.
Supervisor 2 described two boys (did not know their names) and
Youth E outside the door, banging and yelling for Youth I to wake
up and come outside. Supervisor 2 stated Youth I woke up, went
to the door and started talking with the youth outside. Supervisor
2 reported she stood in front of the door and encouraged Youth I
to stay in the unit. Supervisor 2 denied any of the youth in unit 5
leaving the unit. Supervisor 2 reported Supervisor 1 was outside
talking with the youth encouraging them to return to their units and
another staff from CFC was also looking for youth from CFC.
Supervisor 2 stated Youth E left from unit 1 at Vassar House and
the staff in unit 1 stayed in the unit with the other youth.
Supervisor 2 reported the staff that was on break came back and
Supervisor 2 left to assist Supervisor 1. Supervisor 2 described
going to the staff parking lot and seeing only the police and the
10

company van, so Supervisor 2 returned to Vassar House.
Supervisor 2 stated when she returned Youth E was back in unit 1
and told Supervisor 2, she had just gone for a walk.
Supervisor 2 stated Supervisor 1 was looking for the male youth
along with another staff from CFC, but she did not know the name
of that staff. Supervisor 2 stated there were no extra staff to call
for assistance. Supervisor 2 reported Vassar House had one staff
in each unit working and herself. Supervisor 2 stated her staff
could not leave because they had to supervise the youth in the
units and were trying to encourage the female youth to not leave.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at a JDC on September
23, 2024, by Consultant and DHHS Worker 2. Youth E stated
she left unit 1 of Vassar House, met a group of boys outside the
unit and started banging on unit 5 door of Vassar House. Youth E
reported she could not recall what staff was working in unit 1 but
the staff did not leave because there were other youth in unit 1.
Youth E stated staff inside unit 5 would not let Youth E’s friends
leave, so Youth E walked to the gym with the boys. Youth E
reported she could not recall any of the boys’ names.
Youth E stated there were other boys at the gym, and they had
keys to the company vans. Youth E described getting into one of
the vans, listening to music then one of the boys started to drive
the van. Youth E stated there was another boy driving a different
van and that boy crashed the van into a pole in the parking lot.
Youth E stated the police arrived right away and everyone jumped
out of the vans and ran. Youth E reported the only time she saw
staff was in the parking lot and maybe a staff was in their own car
following. Youth E reported she did not know how the boys got
the company van keys and reiterated she did not know any of the
boys’ names. Youth E stated she returned to her unit, was
searched by staff and went to bed. Youth E denied being injured.
Youth F was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 25, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth F reported he ran out of his unit with other youth and staff
followed them until Youth F and the other youths finally lost staff.
Youth F stated it was dark, the youths ran in different directions
and staff could not see where the youth ran. Youth F reported he
could not recall how many staff were looking but Youth F could
see lights from flashlights and hear staffs’ voices. Youth F stated
youth were able to get back into the facility because a youth had
placed a rock in the door so it would not close all the way. Youth
11

F described he came back to the facility and that is when he broke
into the supervisor office.
Youth F described finding a piece of metal and using it to break
into the supervisor office door. Youth F stated he broke into the
office to get “walkies” when the other youth grabbed and smashed
the wooden box that had the company van keys locked in it.
Youth F reported those youth smashed the wooden box on the
ground until it broke to get the company van keys. Youth F stated
there were maybe two or three other youth. Youth F reported he
could not recall the names of any of the youth. Youth F stated the
plan was not to get the van keys but to get the walkies. Youth F
stated he found the piece of metal in the woods and snuck it back
into his unit in his pants. Youth F reported after breaking into the
supervisor office and the youth took the van keys, Youth F threw
the piece of metal far out into the woods to get rid of it. Youth F
denied any staff being around when he was breaking into the
supervisor office. Youth F stated staff were outside looking for
them. Youth F reported after breaking into the supervisor office
and the other youth stole the van keys everyone ran back outside.
Youth F stated he could hear the “beep beep” from the van and
went to the parking lot. Youth F reported there was one staff at
the parking lot but could not recall who and there was a female
staff on the phone. Youth F described seeing a van crash into a
pole and the police arriving right away. Youth F stated a bunch of
youth ran and returned to the unit. Youth F stated youth run off
the unit during third shift because it is dark, and staff cannot see
where the youth go. Youth F reported staff follow and run after
them if they can but sometimes staff have to stay in the unit with
the youth that do not run off.
Youth F denied being aware of any youth breaking into a medical
cabinet or building and stealing medication.
Youth G was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 25, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth G described at night there is only one staff in the unit with
four youth. Youth G reported if youth run off the unit the staff will
stay in the unit with the youth who do not run and call a
supervisor. Youth G stated this night a youth (Youth G did not
know who) took Staff 4’s walkie and ran. Youth G reported Staff 4
went to the unit door and yelled out to Supervisor 1. Youth G
stated Supervisor 1 was out looking for the youth that ran.
Youth G reported being in the unit and hearing Staff 4 and
Supervisor 1 talk about youth stealing the company van keys.
12

Youth G described Staff 4 standing in the unit door leading
outside, talking to Supervisor 1 who was outside looking for youth
(Youth G did not know what youth) who were AWOL. Youth G
stated he ran outside to see what was going on but did not see
anyone. Youth G reported when he ran out of the unit Staff 4
followed him as well as Youth H. Youth G stated he was outside
for approximately seven minutes with Youth H and Staff 4. Youth
G denied seeing any other youth, staff, or anyone driving the
company vans. Youth G reported he returned to the unit with
Youth H and Staff 4 and Youth G went to bed. Youth G stated
when he got up in the morning Youth C and Youth D were back in
the unit. Youth G reported Youth C and Youth D did not look
injured, and they never said anything about the company vans.
Youth G denied being aware of any youth breaking into a medical
cabinet or building and stealing medication. Youth G reported
everything is locked and stated, “I’ve seen it all locked.”
Youth H was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 25, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1.
Youth H reported Youth A, Youth F, and Youth D stole the
company van keys. Youth H stated Youth A, Youth F, and Youth
